You create sprites by defining rectangular <g1>texture regions</g1> in the sprite sheet.
You create sprites by defining rectangular <g1>texture regions</g1> in the sprite sheet.
There are three ways to do this: by using the Magic Wand tool, by setting the edges of the region manually, or by specifying the pixel coordinates in the sprite properties.
There are three ways to do this: by using the Magic Wand tool, by setting the edges of the region manually, or by specifying the pixel coordinates in the sprite properties.
The <g1>Magic Wand</g1> selects the texture region around a sprite automatically.
The <g1>Magic Wand</g1> selects the texture region around a sprite automatically.
This is usually the fastest way to select sprites.
This is usually the fastest way to select sprites.
To select or deselect the Magic Wand, click the icon in the Sprite Editor toolbar, or press the <g1>M</g1> key.
To select or deselect the Magic Wand, click the icon in the Sprite Editor toolbar, or press the <g1>M</g1> key.
To choose how the Magic Wand identifies texture regions, use the <g1>drop-down list</g1> in the toolbar.
To choose how the Magic Wand identifies texture regions, use the <g1>drop-down list</g1> in the toolbar.
The Magic Wand treats the edges of the non-transparent regions as the edges of the texture region.
The Magic Wand treats the edges of the non-transparent regions as the edges of the texture region.
For example, if the sprite is surrounded by transparent space, it sets the texture region at the edge of the transparent space.
For example, if the sprite is surrounded by transparent space, it sets the texture region at the edge of the transparent space.
The Magic Wand identifies texture regions using the color set under <g2>Color key</g2> in the Sprite Editor.
The Magic Wand identifies texture regions using the color set under <g2>Color key</g2> in the Sprite Editor.
For example, if the sprite is surrounded by absolute black (#FF000000), and you set absolute black as the color key, the Magic Wand sets the texture region at the edge of the absolute black space.
For example, if the sprite is surrounded by absolute black (#FF000000), and you set absolute black as the color key, the Magic Wand sets the texture region at the edge of the absolute black space.
You can drag the edges of the texture region and reposition the region manually.
You can drag the edges of the texture region and reposition the region manually.
